Key Arguments: The bill is unnecessary because existing criminal laws already cover issues like incitement to hate crimes.
The bill will harm free speech and is in breach of human rights.
Examples of past censorship, such as the 'lab leak' hypothesis and vaccine transmission issues, demonstrate the dangers of such legislation.
Notable Quotes: The bill is unnecessary. In one of the examples given, there is the situation of incitement to hate crimes. But incitement to commit a hate crime is already subject to criminal law.
The proposed bill will harm free speech. Therefore, it is in breach of human rights.
If the bill passes into law, it will make censorship of legitimate free speech, and therefore breaches of human rights far worse, ingrained, and government-endorsed.
